slideInfo.hText: from <font face='t-Italic' >The Wealth of Nations </font>by Adam Smith, 1776
slideInfo.mainText:
Every individual is continually exerting himself to find out the most advantageous employment for whatever capital he can command.

. . . Every individual who employs his capital in the support of domestic industry, necessarily endeavours so to direct that industry that its produce may be of the greatest possible value.

. . . Led by an invisible hand to promote an end which was no part of his intention. Nor is it always the worse for the society that it was no part of it. By pursuing his own interest he frequently promotes that of the society more effectually than when he really intends to promote it.
